metadata.title: CVE-2024-50268 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:usb: typec: fix potential out of bounds inucsi_ccg_update_set_new_cam_cmd()The "*cmd" variable can be controlled by the user via debugfs.  That means"new_cam" can be as high as 255 while the size of the uc->updated[] arrayis UCSI_MAX_ALTMODES (30).The call tree is:ucsi_cmd() // val comes from simple_attr_write_xsigned()-> ucsi_send_command()   -> ucsi_send_command_common()      -> ucsi_run_command() // calls ucsi->ops->sync_control()         -> ucsi_ccg_sync_control()
